    • lookup

      public java.util.List<java.util.List<LexRecord>> lookup​(java.lang.String pSentence) throws java.lang.Exception
      lookup retrieves terms for a given sentence string. This api returns a list of a list of LexRecords. Each (inner) LexRecord List corresponds to a spelling of a term. There may be multiple lexRecords for a given term, if that term has multiple grammatical senses to it, say a noun and a verb.
      Parameters:
      pSentenceString -
      Returns:
      List> (of Terms)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

      lookup retrieves the terms from a sentence
      Parameters:
      pSentenceTokens -
      Returns:
      List> There will be a list of for each term but in most cases, it will only have one LexRecord in it.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      main Usage: LexicalLookup [--inputFileName] [--outputFileName] LexicalLookup returns a set of terms given a document. Matches are found from three places: the SPECIALIST Lexicon, local terminology, and shape patterns. This program assumes each sentence is bounded by a new line. It does not yet have a sentence tokenizer built in. Options: --inputFileName=/path/to/inputFileName --outputFileName=/path/to/outputFileName The local terminology is not pre-indexed, but read into memory upon startup. This allows for quick integration of new terminology. The local terminology file is read from the classes/resources/localTerminology/localTerminology.LRAGR file. For more information about the local terminology see [ Local Terminology ]

    • addTerm

      public void addTerm​(java.lang.String pLRAGRTerm)

      Parameters:
